questions.question: The War Powers Resolution intended to do what?

choices.answer: Limit the President's power
Give Congress control of the military
Require declarations of war be approved by the SCOTUS
Give the President the power to declare war

questions.question: Executive Orders are directives passed by the President and are...

choices.answer: Unconstitutional and not allowed.
Permanent, they are law unless the SCOTUS overrides them.
Temporary, they expire at the end of the President's term.
Usually designed to deal directly with citizens.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a formal role of the President?

choices.answer: veto legislation
Commander in Chief
make executive agreements
presidential appointments to supreme court

questions.question: Article II of the Constitution says the President Must Be a “Natural Born Citizen,” Meaning…

choices.answer: Must have been born on U.S. soil
Just need to have been born a U.S. citizen, anywhere
Just needs to be a “Born-Again” American Citizen
It’s unclear and has yet to be interpreted by the SCOTUS
the president puts a bill in his pocket
the president adds a signing statement to legislation
congress overrides a presidential veto by a 2/3 majority
congress's term ends before the Pres signs a bill & it dies
beating their opponents to a pulp
using the office as a means of influence for national policy
Using checks and balances on other branches of government
Saying mean things about political opponents

questions.question: What is NOT a constitutional requirement to become President of the United States?

choices.answer: Must have a college education
Must have been a resident of the U.S. for 14 years
Must be U.S. natural born citizen
Must be at least 35 years old

questions.question: Which Constitutional Amendment Formalized Presidential Succession?

choices.answer: The 19th
The 27th
The 25th
The 23rd

questions.question: Which of the following is true when a President Vetoes a bill?

choices.answer: The veto is usually overridden by Congress
SCOTUS Justices can override the veto with a 5-4 majority
Rarely overridden by Congress
The Vice-President can override the veto

questions.question: Who currently holds the record for tallest President of the United States?

choices.answer: Barack Obama
James Madison
Thomas Jefferson
Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: Which President Was a Male Model for Cosmopolitan Prior to Election?

choices.answer: Gerald Ford
JFK
Ronald Reagan
FDR

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of Hamilton's argument in Fed 70?

choices.answer: A plurality in the executive destroys responsibility.
energy in the executive is a leading character of good gov.
unity in the executive best secures the goal of productivity
we should be wary of a single executive as itmodels a king

questions.question: The federal bureaucracy includes which of the following?

choices.answer: Executive Departments (Dept. of Treas)
Independent Regulatory Commissions (FDA)
Executive Agencies (FBI)
Government Corporations (US Post Office)

questions.question: All of the following is TRUE of the federal bureaucracy EXCEPT

choices.answer: Congress can require agency heads to testify in hearings
most its members are appointed by the spoils system
congressional can unfund an agency w/ its power of the purse
they can make their own rules about how laws are enforced
